page.title: 06DOVECOTE FARM,NORTH KYME
page.content: {Dovecote Farm}is owned by the {Maplethorpe}family who have farmed here for 28 years. They grow sugar beet, wheat, potatoes, barley, hay and occasionally peas. They have 50 cows, mainly Hereford and Fresians, which they fatten and take to market at Grantham.They have 320 acres around North Kyme and Anwick Fen.There are 24 fields.They have a lot of implements including a potato harvester,beet harvester, class combine, fertilizer spreader, drag, power harrow, discs, and rollers. There are 7 tractors of which 4 are Fords.The yields are about 3-4 tonnes an acre of barley, 4 tonnes of wheat, and 16-20 tonnes of potates. Two men are employed there as well as Mr. G. Maplethorpe who owns the farm with his mother. The farm is named after an old dovecote that is still used in the farmyard.
